paragraphs.content: Chapter 30
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 30

paragraphs.content: But now they that are younger than I have me in derision, whose fathers I would have disdained to have set with the dogs of my flock.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But now they that are younger than I have me in derision, whose fathers I would have disdained to have set with the dogs of my flock.

paragraphs.content: Yea, whereto might the strength of their hands profit me, in whom old age was perished?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yea, whereto might the strength of their hands profit me, in whom old age was perished?

paragraphs.content: For want and famine they were solitary; fleeing into the wilderness in former time desolate and waste.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For want and famine they were solitary; fleeing into the wilderness in former time desolate and waste.

paragraphs.content: Who cut up mallows by the bushes, and juniper roots for their meat.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who cut up mallows by the bushes, and juniper roots for their meat.

paragraphs.content: They were driven forth from among men, (they cried after them as after a thief;)
paragraphs.contentHtml: They were driven forth from among men, (they cried after them as after a thief;)

paragraphs.content: To dwell in the clifts of the valleys, in caves of the earth, and in the rocks.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To dwell in the clifts of the valleys, in caves of the earth, and in the rocks.

paragraphs.content: Among the bushes they brayed; under the nettles they were gathered together.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Among the bushes they brayed; under the nettles they were gathered together.

paragraphs.content: They were children of fools, yea, children of base men: they were viler than the earth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They were children of fools, yea, children of base men: they were viler than the earth.

paragraphs.content: And now am I their song, yea, I am their byword.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And now am I their song, yea, I am their byword.

paragraphs.content: They abhor me, they flee far from me, and spare not to spit in my face.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They abhor me, they flee far from me, and spare not to spit in my face.

paragraphs.content: Because he hath loosed my cord, and afflicted me, they have also let loose the bridle before me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Because he hath loosed my cord, and afflicted me, they have also let loose the bridle before me.

paragraphs.content: Upon my right hand rise the youth; they push away my feet, and they raise up against me the ways of their destruction.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Upon my right hand rise the youth; they push away my feet, and they raise up against me the ways of their destruction.

paragraphs.content: They mar my path, they set forward my calamity, they have no helper.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They mar my path, they set forward my calamity, they have no helper.

paragraphs.content: They came upon me as a wide breaking in of waters: in the desolation they rolled themselves upon me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They came upon me as a wide breaking in of waters: in the desolation they rolled themselves upon me.

paragraphs.content: Terrors are turned upon me: they pursue my soul as the wind: and my welfare passeth away as a cloud.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Terrors are turned upon me: they pursue my soul as the wind: and my welfare passeth away as a cloud.

paragraphs.content: And now my soul is poured out upon me; the days of affliction have taken hold upon me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And now my soul is poured out upon me; the days of affliction have taken hold upon me.

paragraphs.content: My bones are pierced in me in the night season: and my sinews take no rest.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My bones are pierced in me in the night season: and my sinews take no rest.

paragraphs.content: By the great force of my disease is my garment changed: it bindeth me about as the collar of my coat.
paragraphs.contentHtml: By the great force of my disease is my garment changed: it bindeth me about as the collar of my coat.

paragraphs.content: He hath cast me into the mire, and I am become like dust and ashes.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He hath cast me into the mire, and I am become like dust and ashes.

paragraphs.content: I cry unto thee, and thou dost not hear me: I stand up, and thou regardest me not.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I cry unto thee, and thou dost not hear me: I stand up, and thou regardest me not.

paragraphs.content: Thou art become cruel to me: with thy strong hand thou opposest thyself against me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou art become cruel to me: with thy strong hand thou opposest thyself against me.

paragraphs.content: Thou liftest me up to the wind; thou causest me to ride upon it, and dissolvest my substance.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou liftest me up to the wind; thou causest me to ride upon it, and dissolvest my substance.

paragraphs.content: For I know that thou wilt bring me to death, and to the house appointed for all living.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For I know that thou wilt bring me to death, and to the house appointed for all living.

paragraphs.content: Howbeit he will not stretch out his hand to the grave, though they cry in his destruction.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Howbeit he will not stretch out his hand to the grave, though they cry in his destruction.

paragraphs.content: Did not I weep for him that was in trouble? was not my soul grieved for the poor?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Did not I weep for him that was in trouble? was not my soul grieved for the poor?

paragraphs.content: When I looked for good, then evil came unto me: and when I waited for light, there came darkness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When I looked for good, then evil came unto me: and when I waited for light, there came darkness.

paragraphs.content: My bowels boiled, and rested not: the days of affliction prevented me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My bowels boiled, and rested not: the days of affliction prevented me.

paragraphs.content: I went mourning without the sun: I stood up, and I cried in the congregation.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I went mourning without the sun: I stood up, and I cried in the congregation.

paragraphs.content: I am a brother to dragons, and a companion to owls.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I am a brother to dragons, and a companion to owls.

paragraphs.content: My skin is black upon me, and my bones are burned with heat.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My skin is black upon me, and my bones are burned with heat.

paragraphs.content: My harp also is turned to mourning, and my organ into the voice of them that weep.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My harp also is turned to mourning, and my organ into the voice of them that weep.
